text: As a Californian resident who has been personally affected by wildfires, it is incredibly disheartening to see people not take climate change as seriously as it is. Every year the fires get worse, devastating homes and lives, and the news does a yearly coverage on it and the world moves on. But we don't. It takes years to recover from even one of our fire seasons, and having them occur yearly and getting worse and worse is devastating. I really wish people could start acting as if their homes are on fire too, because ours certainly are, and no one cares and nothing gets done.

text:
¬†@Tom¬† Well, I disagree. With regard to Colbert, he was neutered by CBS much like they did to John Dickerson.  One Tuesday Night this past year on the Late Show, Stephen was his old self. He was promptly given the rest of the week off despite a fully booked week. They didn't even change the descriptions that Cable and Satellite show when you pull up the Channel Guide.
...
The days of cheap, abundant, fossil fuel energy were squandered for two reasons: First for just profits . Second for profit GROWTH after Reagan Cut the Capital Gains Tax and it stayed below the Income Tax Rate ever since.  Energy abundance was squandered for profit instead of for long term planning.

As one of the Oil Insiders stated, Carbon-Man will be remembered as a brief Epoch.
...
A Virologist pointed out that "even a virus will grow to the end of the Petri dish then all will die.  It describes exactly what humans are doing despite declaring themselves superior.

That brings me to Thorium Reactors which have not and never will exit the experimental stage without the extensive taxpayer subsidies that that industry has always relied upon. Such industries should never be for-profit industries (like they have become). The taxpayers assume all the risk while the private companies extract profit (that again, they want to grow).

For all their worship of nuclear power,  they ignore the nuclear reactor 93 million miles from and responsible for all life on Planet Earth, a.k.a. the Sun.

You ignored my point on Bill Gates getting wealthy by urging the unnecessary repetition of selling the same software repeatedly.  It was all only for profit growth with little long term benefits . One can easily appreciate and understand the point by examining the role of the Unix Operating System, a far more robust OS and one that our digitized societies rely upon in countless ways,  every day.

We must exercise the intelligence that we think we have and re-design our societies. Plan both short and long-term for goals that make sense. 

Profit growth demands population growth and we are nearing the end of our Petri dish.
.
author: Arc Anon Drum

text: ¬†@Arc Anon Drum¬† You make some good points. I only side-stepped the Gates story to focus on the thorium reactors. I would need to research more to cross reference your points specific to that issue, but definitely agree that ‚Äútaxpayers assume all risk while the private companies extract profit‚Äù ‚Äî unfortunately this has become a common dynamic in our society. Universities, for example, have huge endowments, while students pay tuition with taxpayer-backed financial aid, and if universities don‚Äôt deliver any value or bully graduate students, oh well.  As far as Colbert, that‚Äôs incredibly unfortunate and depressing. CBS must have granted him free reign to denigrate Trump every night - thankfully. But I would think that Colbert has earned some leverage over these years ‚Äî CBS would be greatly diminished without him.  Finally, I should mention that I have friends accomplished in the field of systems and electrical engineering, and software development, who completely agree with you regarding Gates ‚Äî they often expressed their loathing all those years ago.

text:
Dear Mr. Gates,


I am interested in newly developed (renewable energy generation) transmission technology for the energy transition in the soil. Water and air transport (also airspace / helicopters / military vehicles / drones, etc.).
If you would like to know more, I will send a short information about the scientific background of the transmission development fundamentals.


The idea (problem): If you want to produce more power on the output side, you have to introduce more drive power into the gearbox accordingly. This is a problem with increasing the output on the side. It should actually be possible with lower drive power, multiple output-side power increases.


The solution: The problem is solved with the newly developed integral gear technology. You don't have to increase the drive power if you want to increase the output-side power. This creates a unique selling proposition on the market, as there is no applied technology of the same kind that transforms the inertia and resistance forces away. The driving forces are thus freed from load forces (functional prototype made / tried. It works!). The project and the


Areas of application: This gear technology is used wherever you want to increase the energy yield by approx. 7.8 times. For example, from wind turbines to (special) means of transport (electric drive technologies). The drive power of all means of locomotion and transport will work for years with small batteries. The diesel hold of container ships is being expanded and diesel drives are being abolished. The charging stations for electric cars will be superfluous. Rail traffic will run without a power grid. Funding for the renewable energy product will be increased by 100% until 2026. And these gaps can be closed more quickly after or with the integral gearbox. For the project we have to want the transmission, depending on the different performance classes, to achieve 100% zero Co2 emissions, we have to continue researching the transmission for the application and further developing it for the applications. The gearbox and its products must be marketed immediately.


Conclusion: The infrastructures, the world renewable energy generation technologies are being redesigned. And all the unprofitable contemporary technologies, productions and uses that are dependent on the German economy, the benefit of the environment with the newly developed integral gear technology will be restructured and they will disappear from the world market in a very short time! Integral gear technology will dominate the world energy market. The project is very, very, very big! It's a paradigm shift.


Therefore, I am looking for financial support (funding) from Breakthrough Energy or from Mr. Bill Gates. So that my new renewable energy generation technology must be implemented for the world and the energy industry. Thank you!

Bill Gates got EXTREMELY Wealthy and he saved money when he didn't bother to improve Windows. Computer Makers also made serious coin.

Desktop Computers.  They DON'T need to have always faster components unless the software running on it needs that. Except for gaming, there is really no demand from using a Desktop Computer, they sit there waiting for us to do something and we don't type any faster now than before.  Remember that Smartphones are now, finally, starting with the Galaxy S20, almost comparable to a laptop computer in processing speed and memory but their largest processing requirement remains to be the screen,  which is far smaller than a laptop or desktop screen.

Remember as well that Windows Office was quickly ported to work on Smartphones when they first debuted. Odd?

At its core, each "new" Version of Windows had no upgrades, it is a Desktop Computer Operating System,  not very good at that and very, very poor at everything else (Server, Enterprise Server, Virtual Machine, etc. Microsoft tried and failed miserably to expand their Market Share into big-boy-now territory as well as the distributed product market). text:
an answer to private households who can't afford to invest in renewable energy themselves, would be community-based rental solar panels to a smart grid.

they're given a weekly energy allowance for free (ie : 40% of total energy output, divided by each household), so that the electric company can use their private real estate for generating electricity. (electric company can resell 60% of total generated electricity back to the community, or to other communities and business establishments)

meanwhile, households only need to pay for energy usage exceeding their allotted allowance.

this could easily gain public support for transitioning to renewable energy, since who doesn't want "free" electricity? (technically, their payment is just allowing the electric company to use the roofs of their real estate to generate energy for commercial purposes)

this completely democratizes and decentralize energy generation. coz. 

a) households who can afford to invest in their own solar-panels can own 100% of their generated electricity, which they can sell their surplus to the smart grid.

b) households who can't afford to invest in solar panels, can just let some electric company use their roofs to generate electricity in exchange for getting 40% of energy generated for free.

text:
A rise of CO2 content in the atmosphere of even 5 times what it is today (410 ppm.) would not make the world uninhabitable for mankind. It would need to get well above 2,000 ppm or so to even start causing problems for non-plant life. The pitiful 300 or 500 ppm predicted would not even come close the levels seen at the time of the dinosaurs during the Jurassic, Triassic and Cretaceous periods (a little over 2,000 ppm. ). 

The world‚Äôs bread baskets (the areas that produce food) will most likely move more toward the poles. Possibly turning Northern Siberia and parts of Canada into the next big bread baskets instead of the frozen waste lands they are today.... So things will change, but it will take hundreds of years, more than enough time for populations to move and for food production and industry to adapt.  Again, this end of the world scenarios (desertification drought and famine) being promoted is nothing but propaganda used by globalists to push their agenda..... Why would a world with the climate like that found during the Jurassic, Triassic and Cretaceous periods be so bad? During this time the whole world became one gigantic green house producing not only ten times the food it does today but also the largest land animals and plants that have ever lived. And it did so for over a million years.

Case in point‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.Farmers who run greenhouses pump extra CO2 into their grow rooms to increase production. If it makes their plants produce more food what do you think will happen if all the plants of the entire world get the same treatment? 

With more CO2 in the atmosphere plants grow better and produce more O2 and water vapor (AKA more rain ) and the % of N (nitrogen) in the air drops, the air gets thicker and we all (both plants and animals) breath better....

P.S. How do you verify that your mathematical model of future climate change and its affects are correct? You simply compare it to a time in the past when CO2 levels really did reach the predicted levels‚Ä¶ And when did that happen? During the Jurassic, Triassic, and Cretaceous periods, a time of unparalleled plant and animal growth.

Then follow up with this‚Ä¶.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j2vvgXFmVKw&t=1s

text: When you look at history, every community built around a perishing business or resource died. There never was any form of help for these communities, and there won¬¥t be any this time. All those 40+ year old oil field workers will drop into poverty. Nobody cares for retrained ex oil rig workers, who should hire them? They won¬¥t bew working on building power lines to meet the demand of electric cars. Btw: There will never be masses of electric cars, for one simple reason: Hydrogen. German scientists found a way to store hydrogen in a kind of gel. There is no pressure or extremely deep temperatures needed, and the energy density is 6 times higher as with high-pressure hydrogen. There are only slight adaptions needed to engines to burn hydrogen instead of gas, the only exhaust product is water vapor. There are no adaptions needed to the gas stations, no new power lines have to be built, all reasons why we will see the extremely expensive electric cars fail in the near future. Also, electric cars aren¬¥t any good for the environment as a whole. Sure they save a lot of emissions where they are driven, but when they are built or dismantled, especially the batteries, they make easily up for that. Hydrogen is the way better alternative which just has been unpractical until now because you would have needed a highly pressurized tank, and hydrogen tends to explode when it is mixed with air and comes in contact with an ignition source. Things that tend to happen in accidents. The gel is not explosive, not corrosive, and highly flame retardant. The hydrogen will be extracted from the gel in a chamber before getting injected into the engine, the empty oil, which can be used to store hydrogen again some ten thousand times, will then be stored in a second tank. At the gas station, you will have a gas pump nozzle that pumps the used oil out of the storage tank while at the same time filling enriched oil into your main tank. Very slight adaptations making an enormous difference.

Developing the technology to deal with climate change ie. Monitoring complex webs of energies & mass exchange on a global level & generating algorithms & simulations to predict how various systems will be effected by events and changes over time and to harness its power and guide its flow to maintain proper conditions for complex life to exist while providing the needs for people and technology to continue to grow and develop. This is all precursor technology needed to truly become a type 1 civilization and begin the grind towards a type II. We will need to perfect this technology not only to ensure civilization on Earth endures and lasts but continues to expand to the stars. The data has been reflecting and forecasting these recent events within a range of intensity and frequency for more than 60 years. COVID-19, The Burning West Coast, over a foot of snow in parts of  Texas, More Tornadoes, Hurricanes, rolling Blackouts, failing infrastructure, droughts, heatwaves, Earthquakes, Tsunami's, Eruptions, Mass Migration of every species, as well as civil unrest, Market shortages,  More civil unrest, Heightened surveillance & security, loss of infrastructure for maintaining demand leading to more civil unrest and wars over resources followed by the ever rising rate of mass extinction.  This challenge is Humankinds, as well as the majority of life forms on this planets Fermi/Challenge! 
Will we engineer a way to harness and control nature on a global scale while keeping out wits about us, while also not destroying ourselves in the process of tinkering, competition & political insanity enough to drive masses of people violent while also dealing with the results of our pot of water beginning to reach an uncomfortable temperature. Will the future be full of fantastic inventions, and exploration to harness the power of our solar system? Or will it be a post apocalyptic wasteland of tribes and wanderers scavenging the remains of the post Industrial Age fighting for scrapes and food like something out of Mad Max? Or will it instead be a split of both? I personally find this scenario to be more likely knowing the secrecy and corruption of the Elite class who coldly would pursue the means to control the masses like cattle and control the knowledge, technologies & resources to survive a mass extinction event. Its not like people haven't been thinking about it for centuries. Our reality becomes blurred more and more into the realm of science fiction in both amazing and inspiring ways as well as the terrifying ones. All technologies, ideas, ways of life posses a level of risk and inevitable challenges that drive the force of evolution or lead to extinction. Its a challenge so complicated and intertwined with so many systems on both a scale of mass and time  so large it boggles the mind and pushes our senses of awareness to such an extreme it humbles the individual to but a spec of dust in an endless dessert.

text:
Hydrogen is very upkeep intensive.  Because the molecules are so tiny, (pure hydrogen is the tiniest molecule possible) they osmose into everything and gradually corrode it, no matter what the containment material is.  It's so reactive that it's not found naturally, so it has to be processed just to be found, which itself requires a lot of energy input.  The fuel cells require expensive platinum.  Molecular hydrogen's also not as good an energy carrier as hydrocarbons like methane, which is one of the primary reasons we don't use it very much.
Hydrogen cars are basically electric cars with an onboard generator, so will have any of the downsides a purely electric car with a smaller battery could have, as well as the challenges of hydrogen use.  The vehicles are as clean in use as electric, but still have some of the processing challenges that oil does, including production plant explosions.  Windmills don't ever explode into fireballs.
Wind, water, and sun can be utilized by basic equipment a middle-school student can build and maintain at home.  The complex industrial equipment for the energy grid needs specialization, but the core technology behind using electricity is very simple and clean, compared to any method relying on burning fuel, even if that fuel only shoots water vapor out of the tailpipe.

text:
¬†@Lorenzo Blum¬† ¬†@Lorenzo Blum¬† Who profited far more from oil consumption?
‚ñ™ A. Hollywood
‚ñ™ B. Oil Companies 
If you said "A" then read no further and stop replying (Oh and don't have children,  population growth is a key problem).

‚ñ™ In the USA, the "Power Block" segment on Spike TV each weekend morning was (perhaps still is) 4 thirty minute television shows on boosting horsepower by modifying a car or truck. If it were really a DIY presentation,  they would spend more time on the details. Instead, it is to get people to crave horsepower.  The shows were sponsored, in addition to their advertisers, anonymously by oil companies.

‚ñ™ Speaking of Hollywood,  Los Angeles, California was once the home of a very successful Rail Mass Transit system.  Perhaps one day, YouTube will once again have "Heartbeat of America" hosted by Robert Krulwich, available for viewing. In it, they show the documents that killed the Mass Transit system, they have pictures of how successful it had been. Standard Oil, Firestone and General Motors pooled a portion of their profits,  influenced the privatization of the Mass Transit system,  proceeded to deliberately mismanage it, then when it became unpopular the rails were removed and more roads were built. Considering the wait times in L.A. Traffic,  the big winner of the 3 was Standard Oil.   Presently,  there are videos that REMAIN on YouTube that claim that "...the Los Angeles Mass Transit was 'not that good' and anyway, was never killed by 3 companies that would profit from it being killed...". Apparently criticism of Oil Companies gets someone mad but videos that praise them are okay. 

‚ñ™ The "New Deal" migrated Americans from cheap labor for the wealthy to a strong Middle Class. When Reagan became President,  the Desktop Computer was making its debut. So, there was an Economic Boom but it was because every company in the country needed all of their documents, all of their data digitized.  So a great many people were needed to enter this data onto computers. When I grew up, I was the youngest child of a WW2 Combat Veteran and our family of 11 lived on one income with no taxpayer support. Sending your wife to work full or part time while the kids were at school was attractive for the extra income from a well paying data entry position. It didn't take long however before 2 income families became necessary in the USA just for a family of 4 to afford a Middle Class lifestyle. Since so many companies that profited from the Cold War gleefully shipped American Jobs AND American Technology To COMMUNIST China some Americans were forced to take jobs working for companies woth Billions but that only paid a the Federal Minimum Wage.  What is ironic (is "unfair" okay with you?) is that a dual income family would be paying income tax but the company?  "60 Fortune 500 Companies Paid No Tax" https://youtu.be/suxW2CcKyjk 

‚ñ™ Conclusion : Taking a closer look at Reaganomics, the hiring boom was thanks to a change in Technology (described above). Reagan's Tax Cuts were for corporations and the Wealth Class : "Supply Side or 'Trickle Down' Economics". Finally he cut the Federal Reserve Interest Rate to nearly zero which did 2 things. A. No more protection in an economic slump by using Interest Rate Cuts anymore.  They are low and have stayed there. They now fight economic downturns by printing more money.  B. The low cost of borrowing  drove up prices and that drive up the cost of living. Finally,  it was Reagan who launched the cutting of Tarrifs.  Moving jobs overseas became possible because protectionism was fading and borrowing to move jobs there was low-cost.

Do not lecture me. I am well aware that the Human Race is speeding full tilt towards wiping itself off of the planet but unless we reverse the Reagan Tax Cuts on Capital Gains, Executives will continue to reward themselves by growing, GROWING profits Every. Single. Quarter.using any means necessary to boost the Stock Price, cash out and not be taxed at all, or at least FAR below the Income Tax Rate. I am a Software Engineer with a long career,  I was hired at a startup company and received 40,000 Stock Options.  My first thought was the number of shares that Primary Investors and Company Executives had to play with...

text:
¬†@dibyo haldar¬† ¬†You have that exactly  backwards. Newer versions of Windows (starting with Windows 95 because,  I worked alongside the Product Manager at NEC Technologies in Boxborough, MA at the time and he spotted the fraud immediately, he saw the demo, we shared an office) was PURPOSELY made to require more RAM, more storage and more processing power simply to give the illusion of progress. Windows was purposely made to NOT be backward compatible with previous versions.  That meant that if one person in your office "upgraded" then EVERYONE in that office had to upgrade as well - JUST TO read the documents.  Remember,  companies sent documents to each other electronically so guess what? THEY had to "upgrade" as well. Bill Gates defrauded the public but the real money maker, the real real coup de t√¢t was fooling just enough companies to create a domino effect.  

Microsoft Windows was for  DESKTOP Computers.  They DON'T need to be constantly "upgraded" unless the software running on it needs that (WE didn't get any faster). Except for gaming, there is really no demand from using a Desktop Computer. Gaming by the way, is mostly a demand on the graphics and they are  now; whole computers inside your computer, they're called Graphics Cards and yep, they run the Display. Smartphones are just now, FINALLY, starting with the Galaxy S20, almost comparable to a laptop computer in processing speed and memory but their largest processing requirement remains to be the screen,  which is far smaller than a laptop or desktop screen.

It's a great indication of Fraud by the way when the Windows and Excel programs that "needed a faster computer" worked just fine on Smartphones when they first came out...

At its core, each "new" Version of Windows had no upgrades, it is a Desktop Computer Operating System,  not very good at that and very, very poor at everything else (Server, Enterprise Server, Virtual Machine, etc. Microsoft tried and failed miserably to expand their Market Share into big-boy-now territory as well as the distributed product market). Microsoft had so much money from so much fraud, they were able to block companies that would have made a difference early). The damage from their pretend Windows C++ product used as leverage to purchase the real deal :  Borland C++ then proceed to (rename it and) make it for only Windows platforms was a BIG step backward for technological progress.  THAT Should have been the focus of the Anti-Trust lawsuit brought against Microsoft - a lawsuit dismissed by the way, when Dubya "won" that's right, in quotes : "won" the Presidency.
.
Bill Gates has done plenty of harm including using his Tax Shelter; The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for funding news media (PBS, BBC, Link TV) to NOT, to NOT produce and air stories that might "tarnish", shall we say? their image. He should never be trusted.

text: There are so many use cases where nothing comes close to replacing liquid chemical fuel for a variety of profoundly hard to solve engineering problems. Never mind the basic Human psychological problems that already stand in the way of "How to avoid climate disaster." He isn't even addressing all the new human problems the kind of changes and adjustments his "drive" for implementation of this "innovation" will create. I just have a really hard time seeing how tossing out the internal combustion motor is remotely possible in thirty years without MASSIVE changes to human aspirations. To accomplish work takes energy. The butcher's energy bill gets paid one way or another, or, Homo saps are in for a real sh*t-storm of diminishing expectations, all other things being equal. Primates are not programmable like a computer. Make the wrong policy changes and a lot of us will die and many others will have shorter lives. We can't be rebooted after the vital signs monitor goes blue-screen. Besides, if history teaches us anything, it is that our population always expands to exceed the available resources to support our ability to reproduce in conditions other than hunger and squallor for the majority. So any breakthroughs R&D provides only buys a little more time. Could you imagine what a hellscape of overcrowding would result from the Cold Fusion fantasy if it came true! text:
Reconsider your feelings for the guy who polluted Planet Earth with e-Waste that wants to save the Earth now. Ponder for a moment,  the Globalist who lectured others on the spread of Viruses.

Perfectly good computers (there is very little difference from Windows 95 to Windows 10) litter Planet Earth while Bill Gates lied to people every Holiday shopping season with claims that his "new" Version of Windows was "new, innovative.... [blah, blah,blah, lies,  lies, lies]".  Bill Gates had plenty of time and money to do the right thing but he never took responsibility for the depletion of Earth's Resources and the billions of computers discarded too soon. Even the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation is simply a Tax Shelter that purchases influence.

Desktop Computers.  They DON'T need to have always faster components unless the software running on it needs that. Except for gaming, there is really no demand from using a Desktop Computer, they sit there waiting for us to do something and we don't type any faster now than before.  Remember that Smartphones are now, FINALLY starting with the Galaxy S20, almost comparable to a laptop computer in processing speed and memory but their largest processing requirement remains to be the screen,  which is far smaller than a laptop or desktop screen.

At its core, each "new" Version of Windows had no upgrades, it is a Desktop Computer Operating System,  not very good at that and very, very poor at everything else (Server, Enterprise Server, Virtual Machine, etc. Microsoft tried and failed miserably to expand their Market Share into big-boy-now territory as well as the distributed product market). Microsoft had so much money from so much fraud, they were able to block companies that would have made a difference early). The damage from their pretend Windows C++ product used as leverage to purchase the real deal :  Borland C++ then proceed to (rename it and) make it for only Windows platforms was a BIG step backward for technological progress.  THAT Should have been the focus of the Anti-Trust lawsuit brought against Microsoft - a lawsuit dismissed by the way, when Dubya "won" that's right, in quotes : "won" the Presidency.

Bill Gates has done plenty of harm including using his Tax Shelter; The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for funding news media (PBS, BBC, Link TV) to not produce and air stories that might "tarnish", shall we say? their image. He should never be trusted.

text:
I have solar panels and a Tesla Powerwall battery and I love them! Tomorrow they are working on power poles on my street and the grid will be down for 5 hours, but I don‚Äôt mind! I opted to get the battery even though it cost fully half of what the panels cost, because otherwise the panels would be shut down when the grid goes down. And in earthquake country, the grid could be down for quite a while!

I‚Äôm still paying them off, but haven‚Äôt paid anything to my electric company since they were installed, and the 30% federal tax credit made them pretty affordable. I live in southern CA which may have laws friendlier to solar than many states, but Texas and California both get plenty of solar energy hitting our roofs, so in the long run they are likely to save you money.

Also like you, I am a big fan of Bill Gates and find his detractors baffling.

text:
The last part is celebrity life, especially when they express any opinions.  He was trying to focus on what the world needs, not what Bill Gates needs.
As for how we make greener products cool, Tesla is the model for that.  They know they're not the end solution, however, contrary to people who like to detract from their accomplishments.  While auto fuel is only one step in the right direction, all the steps are needed and Tesla has made it sexy for people to take that particular step.  (Literally SEXY, with their model letters...)
Other industries need to find their own hooks, and the sooner they do, the sooner they can profit from going green, instead of digging humanity a slightly deeper grave each day.  Machines can be replaced.  Workers can be retrained.  We don't need to rely on combustion as much as we do, and the ways we do can be much cleaner than they are now.
Oil and coal companies can be energy companies that diversify into clean methods of gathering energy.  Some will be remade, some will be bought out, some will just die.  The change will come, and the sooner each person and organization gets behind it, the more likely they and the rest of us will survive.

text:
Bill Gates and Woody Allen look like third cousins. I'm also getting a hint of Groucho Marx in there, curiously enough. What I'm not getting a hint of is how a Foundation, an alleged charity, is really based on PRI (Profit Return Index). Not sure why that matters in the case of getting the homeless sheltered, and so that might explain why that hasn't been done when 3D printed housing can be done for 4 000 USD per unit if done in bulk. Can't have it both ways Bilbo, I hear the talk but...
  As far as Bill and Trevor, I like these guys, I might even say they are possibly AWESOME. I have questions though, lots of probing questions that might make certain people uncomfortable. My intuition is telling me Bill Gates is one of the good guys, I'm usually, but not always, correct. 
  In the case of Trevor, who's bright and humorous, I would wonder why he didn't wear different attire for the interview, each article of clothing has its appropriate place, like the gym or the U.N. As Shakespeare said, "The clothes oft proclaim the man." I discern Bill likes Trevor but I have been watching the show Lie To Me,  I see body language and facial expressions. I suspect it links back to the fact that Trevor was so dressed down, Gates may have at least subconsciously taken that personally in a way that Trevor didn't intend but should have had the common sense to know. I will not judge the hair, pandemic hair is one label, he looks better with it shorter. 
  Like it or not, people judge us by our appearance and if you're doing a program interviewing Bill Gates you might wanna forego the hoodie and go GQ on the program. You're not a scrub Trevor, come on man.

text:
¬†@Messiah Majid¬† "Wow, what a Shock" that I have to explain Globalism to the clown that worships the billionaire who spends his money Marketing himself.

"Trade" implies equal footing,  getting something in return for giving. "Globalism" is the corporate driven expansion for Profits. China once had absolutely NOTHING to offer "in Trade". China's Asset was cheap land for factories, laws that the corporations wanted, disposal policies that the corporations wanted and Most of all; Cheap Labor. 

(When Chinese Labor becomes too expensive,  the Jobs will move again,  perhaps to Vietnam as some already have or perhaps to the USA if the corporations are able to destroy our economy and our laws in time for Labor costs to be as low as China's were when jobs first moved there.)

Cheap Labor boosts profits and I am not going to bother explaining why profit growth matters so much to the 1%. Simpletons like you can barely grasp what I am writing now but you will certainly try to take credit later.

Every year, like clockwork and before the Holiday buying season,  your hero Bill, figgityfaggity Gates would stand in front of any and every camera proclaiming that "this new version of Windows is the best ever, it's innovative, [blah, blah, blah, lies, lies, lies]..." and people would fall for it, every year. Worst of all were the directors of IT at companies. But their hands were tied because as I said before; Windows was purposefully made to NOT be backward compatible if a company dealt with another company that had "upgraded" their computers to run the "new" Windows with the "new" Microsoft Office,  the other company had to "upgrade" as well -- just to read the stupid document.

Stop and sip your $5 coffee and think about that for a while before you keep reading Stenchleton.

AT&T, later Lucent Technologies owned the rights to Unix, a software Operating System open enough to be modified (under license) and supported by more than just Lucent - meaning Unix Computer makers had control of the software on the computers and could value-add features that made them unique to the Market they pursued. text:
¬†@Arc Anon Drum¬† I don't worship Bill Gates but I will not demonize  him because of conspiracy theories. 
Now to dissect your points.
 First off, Paul James defines globalism at least in its more specific use as the dominant ideology and subjectivity associated with different historically-dominant formations of global extension. The definition thus implies that there were pre-modern or traditional forms of globalism and globalization long before the driving force of capitalism sought to colonize every corner of the globe, for example, going back to the Roman Empire in the second century AD, and perhaps to the Greeks of the fifth-century BC. 
Globalism is not a new concept. The world gained gunpowder, tea and silk from China because of early globalism.
Global governments were just as interested in expanding trade to boost their GDP as the corporations, case in point,In 1979 the U.S. and China reestablished diplomatic relations and signed a bilateral trade agreement. This gave a start to a rapid growth of trade between the two nations. That could not exist if China had nothing to offer, which brings me to debunking your next lie, the fact that China had nothing to trade with except cheap labor and land.

In agriculture, major crops are rice, wheat and corn as well as barley, soybeans, tea, cotton and tobacco. China has become the world's leader in both fishing and aquaculture. Timber is another major resource. The country has become a world leader in production of pigs, chickens and eggs.
China has extensive deposits of coal, oil and natural gas. Besides these fossil fuels, China is a top producer of aluminum, magnesium, antimony, salt, talc, barite, cement, coal, fluorspar, gold, graphite, iron, steel, lead, mercury, molybdenum, phosphate rock, rare earths, tin, tungsten, bismuth and zinc. China exports antimony, barite, rare earths, fluorspar, graphite, indium and tungsten, and it leads the world in domestic mining of gold, zinc, lead, molybdenum, iron ore and coal. You called me a simpleton. Well, even a simpleton like me knows that these are major resources for manufacturing electronic components, something electronic companies needed as they competed with each other. Same goes for automotive companies and a plethora of other industries. Not only that, but Japan, China's largest trade partner, was one of the world's largest exporters of copper, iron, steel, essential to computing and manufacturing. China knew this and incentivized US companies  with cheap labor, and cheap cost of production. It was much bigger than cheap labor. The US knew this and China knew this. 

You somehow manufactured this illusion that the competition between tech companies and unnecessary demand for new computers, as you put it, was solely to blame for manufacturing moving to China when it was just a tiny piece of the pie. And somehow even in your argument, you completely ignore the presence of Apple and IBM and their competition with Microsoft to innovate new computer software. You claim this conspiracy that Bill Gates somehow made IT companies shut up and adopt his software year after year, when if it was as homeostatic and unchanged as you say, they would simply move to Apple software.
Unlike you, I did not attack your personal interests or your intelligence  in order to make my point. My music taste is in no way a reflection of my intelligence, something I don't expect you to understand. You ignoramus masquerading as an intellectual, peddling pseudo facts.

author: Sergej Kuznecov

text:
¬†@Sergej Kuznecov¬† you are disinformed, you won't believe me, sure, you think you know things, and i understand what you believe, but it's misleading half truths, i'm sorry to say.
not only have we been mesuring the global atmosphere temperature, and it is indeed rising, (https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/world-of-change/decadaltemp.php) but we have also recreated history for hundreds of thousands of years using ice records, and we know a lot about the concentration of co¬≤ at various stages of earth history, the picture of the last century is pretty clear, things are getting hot, and it's correlated with co¬≤ concentration.
Yes, the role co¬≤ plays in greenhouse effect is only a small part of the story, but threshord effects are powerful, if you have a well balanced system, a really subtle change on either side can destabilize it, of course, the earth is not a balance staying still and easily disturbed, it's a complex system with a lot of things evolving, but small changes over years can still cause really important results. We are taking millions of tons of carbon from the ground every year and putting them into the atmosphere, the earth is big, but the atmosphere is a pretty thin layer on top of it, and we are managing to increase the number of ppm of co¬≤ globaly sensibly, and it has effects. Vapor is a powerful greenhouse gas, but as far as i know, we are not changing the amount of it in the atmosphere, and thus not making difference on that side.
I absolutely need oxygene, and i'm really happy plants spent the last couple billion years filling up our atmosphere with it, and they ar proably happy (if such a thing is meaningful for a plant) to have more co¬≤, at least in the short term, as it does make their growth easier, but it's not a good thing for us, not because we are going to lack oxygen, there is plenty, and even if we cut all the trees down, it would take a long time to meaningfuly impact the supply, and they absolutely help fighting global warming by using sunlight to break co¬≤ particles and making oxygen out of it, but they do breath to, so they do consume oxygen, and their net output is relatively small, it takes decades for each tree to extract a few tons of carbon from the atmosphere, it's a far cry from what we need to offset our output, even if we were to fill the world with trees (which is not practical, and would destroy a lot of habitats), planting trees is not, in itself, a solution.

text:
¬†@Dejay Rezme¬† You wanne hear a real conspiracy theory about climate change? (In the sense that it sounds really far fetched, not in the sense that it has no basis in facts and doesn't even consider anyone's motivations.) A continued melting of the polar ice will bring two major changes for Russia: 1) It will makes oil and gas fields in the north of the country accessible for the first time. 2) It will clear out ice from the ocean north of Russia, clearing a year round passage for ships through Russian waters for the first time, allowing Russia themselves to use it as a passage way and to tax others who use it.
Not saying that is definitely the reason that Russia is one of the largest polluters that has not ratified the Paris Climate Accord, or for the fact that Putin has repeatedly fearmongered over a planet "covered in several layers of solar panels", but it is certainly interesting. 
Here is an article about Russia joing the PCA including Putin's fearmongering: https://phys.org/news/2019-09-russia-paris-climate-agreement-decree.html
Generally I think it should be pretty obvious to everyone that there are certainly actors, be it countries or companies, who benefit financially from climate change itself, or at least from a lack of effort to stop it. Why else would an entire planet fail to act on a problem that threatens literally everyone for several decades?

It is about how much CO2 from human civilization can change the temperature of the atmosphere and is CO2 the most important factor in warming the atmosphere? There are other factors, water vapor, dust, which cause more greenhouse effect.
For example, your house is heated with gas and emitting CO2. Were you taxed on CO2 and did not heat your house or are you sitting at home in a fur coat?
The climate on Earth depends more on other factors. It's just that you can't tax dust or water vapor, but you can tax CO2, that's all. Why are nuclear power plants being closed? They emit the least CO2, work without surges in electricity production, take up little space, electricity from them is the cheapest. Waste? So in Russia, this radioactive waste has already been processed 6 times and received again plutonium for power plants.
After 6 processing, the level of radiation from waste is the same as that of natural granite. Windmills, solar panels, etc. is an expensive and dead-end development branch. Electricity from them is subsidized by the state, i.e. out of our pockets. When the subsidies end, the windmills and photovoltaic panels are removed, they become unprofitable. They are more expensive to operate than the cost of electricity without subsidies.
The climate on Earth is self-regulating. Excess CO2 isn't always a bad thing. The amount of chlorophyll in plants increases and they absorb more CO2.
If you think and panic like you, then if a couple of volcanoes on Earth become active, then we will all die out. Any development chain cannot be interrupted. It will be possible to switch from atomic energy with uranium and plutonium to thorium, and later to hydrogen and deuterium. The waste will no longer be so radioactive. And if nuclear power is stopped now, then there will be no more development of reactors and technologists in this direction. There will be no more wind on Earth, just as there will be no more sunny days.

text:
There are several organizations that are looking into this, in fact there is lab created meat in stores today. Some are taking the same idea that's used to create tissue medically & instead working towards making viable meat products that are real meat. This is tissue samples taken from an animal, but is non lethal and about as painful as going to a vet for the same thing. So animal cruelty by killing animals for meat could be eliminated. Also, it would help to reduce the amount of animals needed & create healthier, better cared for livestock.

The tissue samples are then used with stem cells to make more animal tissue. Stem cells become whatever they are added to, becoming tendons, meaty tissue or whatever. So in a way, that sample could help to make a very large amount of meat grown in a lab so it's sterilized. Most meat is contaminated in the slaughter house where animals are killed. This bypasses these conditions to make meat safer, healthier & more abundant without the costs of large numbers of animals.

Some take a different approach and make a plant based variety of meat. By using various plants, they create a product that has the same texture, taste and visual look of real meat. Both of these would be a smart way to reduce the huge populations of livestock. It would also work with other animals like turkey, duck, deer, and other wild game animals. All without decimating the populations of these creatures.

If the quality is high enough for use in medical replacement surgeries, why would it not be just as viable to use this method to create a lab grown meat for consumption. Science has also made an amazing breakthrough - Fat cells can be used to make stem cells! It's easier and everyone has at least some fat on them somewhere. Which means, we could use our own fat to treat illnesses we have or damage that's been done by having stem cells made to fix the problem. From fat!

That means it would be easy to create stem cells, thus the creation of lab grown meat from tissue samples would be less costly & nearly unlimited. You only need a few cells to start and add the stem cells to... so that small sample could create hundreds if not thousands of pounds of meat - safe, healthy meat that tastes great!
Check out the stores to see if they are carrying lab meat or plant meat products. See if you can taste the difference... We use meat in stews, meatballs, stroganoff & any number of recipes. They've created beef & chicken, the two most popular. They are going to work on others, once these are doing well... It would be great to reduce the need for thousands of livestock animals to feed people. With how much waste there is in the states, it's sad how much ends up in the trash with how many people are going hungry. We can do a lot better than we are doing right now. This is something the human race is responsible for - time to do what we can to make changes. And to hold responsible those who refuse to do what's right by our planet & the future of our species - and all others. We need to help return the balance to our ecosystem before it's too late.
author: Starrweaver

text:
or instead of waiting on solutions like this, just go plant-based. it's better for the environment, can be better for your body and can also be cheaper.  

edit: or if that is too big of a shift for you, you can at least heavily cut down on animal products. like only eating them in the weekend or something. the thing is: we have gotten way too used to meat being on the table daily. it used to be something for special occasions, but now it's everywhere. that needs to change if we want to reach our climate goals.
author: Gunnar B

text:
¬†@Gunnar B¬† I agree we eat too much, but then we aren't like our ancestors anymore, we've changed. I didn't say it was a good way, but we have changed. Not all of us can deal with going back to plants, our guts would take time to re-calibrate something like that. Plus there are far too many who won't want to change.
So as long as there are huge amounts of livestock making money for their owners - it's going to keep going on.

And get this tidbit - those herds being grazed on public lands by BLM for pennies - most of that meat is for export, with a mere 10% for local sale. These herds are the ones ranchers can't feed at home cause they've another thousand head herd grazing there. These are their export herd to make more money while saving tons of it having them graze on public land. Now that specific land was set aside for the wild mustang & burros. Where are they? Shoved off to poor brush areas where there's little grass, or stuff that's not that good for them. The BLM has also warehoused dozens of herds in places they try to forbid the public despite it not being a private area. Rescuers have had to try to purchase these animals through auctions where the BLM is trying to sell the horses to slaughterhouses. This is disgraceful treatment of these historic animals that helped build this country in the early eras.
We need to reduce livestock for food, not only for the environment, but for the diversity of species. They are trying to "get rid" of mustangs, burros - as well as predators in the area due to ranchers complaining they need their meal tickets protected on public land - our land. The ones benefiting are BLM & ranchers.

It may be difficult, but we need to get meat eaters, I'm one myself. To be more open to not killing their meals. A rare turkey or chicken dinner, rabbit or pork... but the majority should be grown in a lab where it's not going to be contaminated. Eventually, we can shift to grown meat & plants... but we need to get those who are carnivores onboard the nonviolent, nonlethal meat production in a lab. We can't reduce livestock without them cutting way back on dead animals for meat.

text: Affluent countries have a moral responsibility to drive the green premium down so that the technology becomes affordable for less affluent countries. That's the essence of the Gates Rule: If given a choice of cutting emissions directly or reducing the cost of net-zero technology, the U.S. should choose the latter.

text:
Despite all the misgivings I have of Bill Gates when he ran Microsoft, the issue of Climate Change is bigger than any single individual, rich or poor. Everyone needs to pile on to do what we all can to reduce everything that induces Climate Change.
With Texas feeling the gradual effects of Climate Change and short-sighted energy policies that triggered the State of Emergency they're in now, and even as a non-American myself, I can only hope that the Texan voters there can wake up and do the right thing come the next election cycle, vote out the selfish and self-serving politicians with special interests.
